time_clock

This component is used to create periodic timed events with a period specified by the parameter Time Interval or by overriding the parameter by presenting a value to the data input [In]period. Each periodic event triggers the output event [Out]clk. The clock starts when the input event [In]start fires and stops when the input event [In]stop fires.

The clock can be configured to only fire once or to fire repeatedly by setting the parameter Periodic Flag or by overriding the parameter by presenting a value to the data input [In]rpt. Similarly the clock can be configured to reset the time until the next clock event is triggered, every time the input event [In]start fires, by setting the parameter Retriggerable Flag or by overriding the parameter by presenting a value to the data input [In]retrig.

Ports

  • [In] start:

    Input event, starts the clock.

  • [In] period:

    Data input, time interval for firing clock events. Overrides the parameter Time Interval.

  • [In] rpt:

    Data input, specifies if clock fires only once or periodically. Overrides the parameter Periodic Flag.

  • [In] retrig:

    Data input, specifies if the timer is reset every time the input event [In]start is triggered. Overrides the parameter Retriggerable Flag.

  • [Out] clk:

    Output event, fired periodically after the interval specified by the parameter Time Interval or by the data input [In]period.

  • [In] stop:

    Input event, stops the clock.

  • [Out] :

    Output event.

  • [Out] :

    Output event.

Parameters

  • Time Interval (uSecs):

    Time interval between events.

    Data Type:

    I,

    Min Value:

    1,

    Max Value:

    2147483647,

    Default Value:

    1000000

  • Periodic Flag:

    [Parameter3]

    Data Type:

    B,

    Min Value:

    1,

    Max Value:

    Periodic if TRUE, single delay only if FALSE. ,

    Default Value:

    None

  • Retriggerable Flag:


    Data Type:

    B,

    Min Value:

    1,

    Max Value:

    Retriggerable if TRUE. ,

    Default Value:

    None

State Machine

Stateless.

Profiles

All.

Toolbox

Core.

Version

v2.1.

Native Dependencies

  • TDK1.1:

Licence Type

LGPL.

Component Supplier

inx ltd.
